intro: Mayepea domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican mayepea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Mayepea domingensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
